required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Videoconferencing Between Ambulances and Physician Manned Rapid Response Vehicles, Effects on On-site Patient Treatment and Patterns of Referral
clinical_study.official_title: Telemedical Solutions in Medical Emergencies, Advantages and Disadvantages for Patients, Healthcare Professionals, and Healthcare System. Study 3: Videoconferencing Between Ambulances and Physician Manned Rapid Response Vehicles, Effects on On-site Patient Treatment and Pattern of Referral

brief_summary.textblock:
Physician manned rapid response vehicles are a limited resource in the prehospital handling of acute patients.
In this study mobile videoconferencing between ambulances and the rapid response vehicles enables patient consultation at a distance. Video consultation between patient and the prehospital physician can take place when the patient is at home or in the ambulance.
The primary aim of this study is to examine the effect of video consultation between physician manned rapid response vehicles and patients receiving treatment by ambulance personnel on the number of patients receiving final treatment on-site in the pre-hospital setting

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients receiving final treatment on-site prehospitally
primary_outcome.time_frame: Final treatment is registered for the present consultation, expected assesment averagely within 1 hour. Expected to be presented up to 36 months after assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 3 days of primary contact. Will be assessed up to 24 months after primary contact. Expected to be presented up to 36 months after assessment.
secondary_outcome.description: For all patients receiving consultation from physician manned rapid response vehicles the number of patients admitted to hospital within 3 days will assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: If destination for patient is changed during consultatation with physician it wille be assessed at the end of consultation, expected averagely to be within 1 hour after consultation, expected to presented up to 24 months after primary assessment
secondary_outcome.description: If the department to receive the patient is changed during consultation between physician in rapid response vehicle and patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of treatments delivered by ambulance personnel
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The number of treatments delivered by ambulance personnel during consultation with physician in rapid response vehicle. Expected to be assessed averagely within 1 hour of consultation. Expected to be presented up 36 months after primary assessment

other_outcome.measure: Ambulance staff evaluation of usability of equipment
other_outcome.description: Is investigated by the use of survey
Is investigated by the use of survey

clinical_study.condition: All Acutely Ill or Injured Patients Receiving Care by Ambulance Personnel

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm receive video consultation from physician in doctor manned rapid response vehicle.
Patients receiving prehospital care by ambulance personnel whom receive telephone consultation/supervision by physician in rapid response vehicle.

intervention.description: iPad air with 4G/3G SIM card is used as device for videoconferencing. LifeSizeClearSea solution is used for videoconferencing. Video consultation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients receiving prehospital care by ambulance personnel
- Must receive either telephone or video consultation by physician in rapid response vehicle
Exclusion Criteria:
